intro: Physaria hemiphysaria subsp. hemiphysaria, commonly known as the yellow sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, showy yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. The species is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed habitats and is often found in desert scrub and grassland ecosystems.
